body.plain:
Hedley, Jemma, I visited this L2 performance meeting last week. Coming from the previous role here at GRM as one of the Processing Superintendents, seeing the difference this has made is outstanding. The inclusive language used between both Maintenance and Operations was superb, the use of BOS practices to identify and seek understanding was also another highlight.
It has opened up the door to so many possibilities for the two plants and 4 teams as they work as one team to deliver value to the GRM operation.

Well done to all involved. #bosinaction #2getheronecpp

body.plain:
The WAIO P25 Tech Down Solution is now in production phase. The P25 Tech Down Solution can be used by any WAIO P25 Port & Rail User.

Currently the innovation is being used by the Rail Infrastrucutre Signals & Communications Team.

If you are interested in using the system or the innovation, please contact the Rail Communications Team.

I have attached a video for deomonstration reference.

Well Done and thank you to Rail Projects, Motorola Solutions Australia & The Rail Communication Team during all phases of the project.

body.plain: Great share Brady, Shaun we often get all wound up in the Engage and Aspire phase, the excitement of discovery. Though the real BOS rubber hits the road in this space. We have identified the opportunities, now its time to enact upon them to realise value, put wheel chocks behind our uplift and seek more. Great to see the ONECPP team #2getheronecpp embracing the MIP process as one to unlock the potential the teams can bring to the table.

body.plain: It means becoming comfortable with taboo subjects in our workplaces and cultures. Quite often the mental and emotional arithmetic involved in speaking out is not insignificant - and so transformative gifts come at an exacting, sometimes immutable personal cost.

body.plain:
El 28 de Agosto celebramos Wear it purple.
Mientras mis hijas ayudaron hoy a teñirme el pelo, pruguntaron porque hago tal cosa. Mi dio la oportunidad de explicarles que significa LGBT+ y diferencias en orientación sexual. Nuestras diferencias nos hacen únicas y enriquece quiénes somos. Abrazamos la diversidad juntas... ellas se unieron al Wear it purple, tu también?
#wearitpurple #somoselcambio

body.plain:
All to often we blame tools (e.g. the ‘Performance Board’ isn’t working or the ‘Value Stream Map’ isn’t effective enough). It’s like a golfer blaming their golf club when their swing is the problem.

Tools are a means to an end and not the end in themselves. They are strategically applied to solve a specific need. There are hundreds of tools that can be used in the pursuit of perfection, like a set of golf clubs in a golfers bag to win a tournament. The tool in itself is worthless unless used in a very specific manner. The manner is defined by the intent or outcome required when used.

Focusing on the objective first will help us select the right tool. Once selected we need to use the tool well to fulfil the original need. Blaming tools takes away from what we are ultimately trying to improve through BOS - ourselves.

body.plain: Thank-you and everyone else in BHP Hazel! It has been really amazing to see how selflessly people have stepped up through the COVID-19 pandemic. I know that it has been an incredibly difficult period and yet somehow our people have managed to keep our operations and supply chain safely running. We haven’t missed a beat. Commitment and resilience that we can all be proud of. A story that I am honoured to share with others!

body.plain:
The ONECPP team, Production and Maintenance from Goonyella CPP1 and Riverside CPP2 have come together to launch their joint L2 MOP Board!

With the 4 teams from 2 Prep Plants coming together as one and through strong collaboration, the first dry run of their L2 MOP was completed on Thursday 16th July. The dry run was led by Franks, Murray - Processing Superintendent and Booyens, Johan - Fixed Plant Maintenance Superintendent with high levels of engagement and ownership from the Supervisors and Process Engineers from both plants.

This is the first face to face meeting for all 4 teams since Covid19 with good social distancing in place. During the E&A phase, Field Observations and S90 project it was identified that the Supervisors are unable to get into the field/work areas until mid-morning.

One of the challenges was their existing team meeting was held daily at 7:30am. The L2 MOP replaced this meeting and has been moved to 11:30am to ensure Supervisors get into the field early in their shift.

A great session and well done to all involved!

#2getheronecpp #bosinaction #visualisingandmanagingperformance #empowerourpeople #persueperfection

cc: Cotter, Warren, Taylor, Hannah, McDonald, Kevin, Ney, Geoffrey, Brady, Shaun, Bacon, Gregory, Ranjan, Shwetank, Gee, Brent, Peri, Matt, Gray, Stewart, Hahn, Alexandra, Doran, Scott, Lines, Matt, Hegarty, Iain, Hanning, Sarah

references.content_excerpt:
The ONECPP team, Production and Maintenance from Goonyella CPP1 and Riverside CPP2 have come together to launch their joint L2 MOP Board!

With the 4 teams from 2 Prep Plants coming together as one and through strong collaboration, the first dry run of their L2 MOP was completed on Thursday 16th July. The dry run was led by Franks, Murray - Processing Superintendent and Booyens, Johan - Fixed Plant Maintenance Superintendent with high levels of engagement and ownership from the Supervisors and Process Engineers from both plants.

This is the first face to face meeting for all 4 teams since Covid19 with good social distancing in place. During the E&A phase, Field Observations and S90 project it was identified that the Supervisors are unable to get into the field/work areas until mid-morning.

One of the challenges was their existing team meeting was held daily at 7:30am. The L2 MOP replaced this meeting and has been moved to 11:30am to ensure Supervisors get into the field early in their shift.

A great session and well done to all involved!

#2getheronecpp #bosinaction #visualisingandmanagingperformance #empowerourpeople #persueperfection

cc: Cotter, Warren, Taylor, Hannah, McDonald, Kevin, Ney, Geoffrey, Brady, Shaun, Bacon, Gregory, Ranjan, Shwetank, Gee, Brent, Peri, Matt, Gray, Stewart, Hahn, Alexandra, Doran, Scott, Lines, Matt, Hegarty, Iain, Hanning, Sarah

body.plain:
WAIO Rail Communication Team in conjunction with Motorola Solutions Australia have been working hard on a concept project called “Tech Down Solution”. This project has been able to provide a solution to Rail Infrastructure & Rail Communication Personnel working alone. The concept has provided the capacity for Hand-Held Radio’s to be motion monitored and in case of an medical event an emergency distress alarm automatically is sent to the Network Operation Centre in Nelson Point where the appropriate emergency response can be sent. The concept also provides a GPS location on a tracking map, with the location of the distress team member.

Currently the concept is live and evaluation in 4 months will occur to see the sustainability of the concept.

references.content_excerpt:
WAIO Rail Communication Team in conjunction with Motorola Solutions Australia have been working hard on a concept project called “Tech Down Solution”. The concept has provided the capacity for Hand-Held Radio’s to be motion monitored and in case of an medical event an emergency distress alarm automatically is sent to the Network Operation Centre in Nelson Point where the appropriate emergency response can be sent. The concept also provides a GPS location on a tracking map, with the location of the distress team member.

Currently the concept is live and evaluation in 4 months will occur to see the sustainability of the concept.

body.plain:
ONECPP Team at GRM started their MIP journey on Tuesday this week. Superintendents Booyens, Johan and Line, Matt presented with passion and conviction to tell their story of ONECPP through BOS Practice No.10 Managing Improvement Projects. The team elaborated on their future vision of success, with the Superintendents asking for engagement and ownership from the ONECPP team. Moving forward if we work together as a combined team we will be succesful and create great outcomes for the future of ONECPP.

#2getheronecpp #onecpp #bosinaction #empowerourpeople #persueperfection

cc: Ney, Geoffrey, Gee, Brent, Cotter, Warren, Ranjan, Shwetank, Gleadhill, Greg, Doran, Scott, Hahn, Alexandra, Franks, Murray, McDonald, Kevin, Hegarty, Iain, Kelly, Todd, Hanning, Sarah, Gray, Stewart, Peri, Matt, Taylor, Hannah, Bacon, Gregory, Hedley, Jemma

body.plain:
We have been on the hunt for help in the Women in Perth space, and we are pleased to introduce you to two of our newest members!

Ellen Marinko has been with us for a couple of months now, stepping into the treasury role for WIP. Ellen has been at BHP for two years and joined after graduating with an honours in mathematics & statistics from UWA. She is currently working in the Algorithms and Applications team in the Enterprise and Global Digital Factory.

Ellen is passionate about diversity and inclusion within the technology and mining sector and promoting women and girls' participation in STEM. Outside the office, you can find her mentoring a group of year 10 girls as they build a recycling phone app, studying for her web-application course – as a recipient of a 2020 She-Codes scholarship, at the dog beach with her schnauzer Miffy or cooking/baking/eating out/anything related to food. Ellen is super excited to take on the role of treasurer and be part of this awesome WIP cohort!

And our newest new member, Kathryn Horlin, has just joined as a WIP lead! Kathryn’s career has spanned over 18 years in diverse industries, predominantly mining. In her 13 years at BHP she has held corporate and site roles in the Nickel, Iron Ore, and Group divisions. She is now the Principal Carbon Management in the Sustainability & Climate Change team, within External Affairs. Kathryn holds a double degree in Environmental Engineering and Chemistry, and she is a graduate member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors.

Kathryn has held a range of roles leading teams and projects, and enjoys mentoring and supporting others in their development. In 2011, Kathryn was nominated by the Nickel West lead team for the CME Women in Resources Professional Award for her leadership and mentoring of junior females. In 2019 she was a Lean-In Lead for BHP’s female mentoring initiative and a mentor in the Industry Mentoring Network in STEM.

Kathryn is a passionate advocate for flexible work enabling people to balance work and life effectively. She has two children, aged 4 and 7 years old. Kathryn has been working part-time and flexibly for seven years.

We’re always on the lookout for helping hands! Are you interested in helping out WIP? Send me an email!

cc: Marinko, Ellen, Horlin, Kathryn

Today we have another group of excited operators starting their journey with Operations Services at Saraji.
The Cultural Induction is being run dynamically by production superintendent Lynch, Karina via Webex and by the on-site leadership team. The use of video has allowed us to maintain a high level of engagement with the new starters.

Welcome aboard!!

#connectedness #technology #osway #oneteamsaraji

Crawford, Ian Rogerson, Louise Kendall, David Gurnick, Destry Jones Dunshea, Cheryl Comiskey, Clytie Proffitt, Alisha Hoare, John Lobegeier, Brad Harlow, Ashley Wolff, Neville Gordon, Robert Bruce Cochrane, Scott

body.plain:
Small Device, Large Gain

Recently at a Goonyella Cultural Induction session we tested the use of a Nighthawk network/wifi device to improve our presentation and connection speed at the Eureka Village for our numerous laptops.

This has enabled the the following to take place and make significant gains;

Day 1 Cultural Induction completed with efficiency
Enabled E-learning to be completed and new inductees to obtain visitor passes to Goonyella. The knock on effect lead into Day 2.

Day 2. This enabled Fatigue Management Training Delivery, and Tyre Awareness Training to be completed without having to leave the camp confines, in addition the extra time gained back has enabled the inductees to complete their on site WAF and commencement of Surface Mobile Equipment sign offs within the first 2 days.

This removed any requirement for buses to move people to and from Moranbah some 30 minutes away, removed costs of transport, removed lost time.

Creating a better experience all round for our teams

Osborne, Sussanah Scott, Dean

#connected, #performance https://media.tenor.com/images/b7df9f7e9793d8855ec415b90deb5cc0/tenor.gif

references.content_excerpt:
Small Device, Large Gain

Recently at a Goonyella Cultural Induction session we tested the use of a Nighthawk network/wifi device to improve our presentation and connection speed at the Eureka Village for our numerous laptops.

This has enabled the the following to take place and make significant gains;

Day 1 Cultural Induction completed with efficiency
Enabled E-learning to be completed and new inductees to obtain visitor passes to Goonyella. The knock on effect lead into Day 2.

Day 2. This enabled Fatigue Management Training Delivery, and Tyre Awareness Training to be completed without having to leave the camp confines, in addition the extra time gained back has enabled the inductees to complete their on site WAF and commencement of Surface Mobile Equipment sign offs within the first 2 days.

This removed any requirement for buses to move people to and from Moranbah some 30 minutes away, removed costs of transport, removed lost time.

Creating a better experience all round for our teams

Osborne, Sussanah Scott, Dean

body.plain:
This is one of the reasons why I’m proud to work at BHP: our commitment to social value. I see examples of this every day in so many parts of the company, and it’s something we haven’t left to the wayside during this Covid-19 period, as this Yammer group can attest to.
Thanks for sharing some of the work we do with the world Mike.

Prioritize people in times of crisis: An interview with the CEO of BHP | McKinsey

https://www.mckinsey.com/featured-insights/asia-pacific/prioritize-people-in-times-of-crisis-an-interview-with-the-ceo-of-bhp#
